title: Understanding Stress Reactions
text: Stress can trigger a variety of physiological responses in the body. These responses are part of the body's natural defense mechanism to perceived threats.

title: Common Symptoms of Stress
text: Think about how your body reacts when you are stressed. Do you notice any changes in your heart rate or breathing?

hintAnswer: increased heart rate, elevated blood pressure, rapid breathing, tensed muscles, sweating, digestive issues (nausea, diarrhea, or constipation), weakened immune system, and insomnia or sleep disturbances
title: Identifying Physiological Reactions
text: List some common physiological reactions that occur when a person is under stress.
choices: a $$first-line$$ choice in the management of mania and mixed mania, and with bipolar maintenance

increased heart rate, elevated blood pressure, rapid breathing, tensed muscles, sweating, digestive issues (nausea, diarrhea, or constipation), weakened immune system, and insomnia or sleep disturbances
a class of medications that help clients fall and stay asleep
a heightened state of arousal and worry that may not always have a clear external cause
